bullets.text: Global tech-led selloff deepens; SoftBank plunges; Asia stocks follow; U.S. yields rise as shutdown ends, trimming odds of near-term rate cuts.
U.S. new foreclosures jumped 20% in October, signaling rising housing-market distress as high rates and affordability pressures persist.
White House readies tariff exemptions to ease food inflation, even as Trump-era levies help push U.S. beef prices to record highs.
U.S.-China trade truce carries quotas that may cap U.S. soybean sales, limiting relief for American farmers.
U.S. officials raise concerns over Saudi bid for F-35s, citing security and technology-transfer risks amid shifting Middle East alignments.
Canada accelerates plan to reduce U.S. trade reliance, seeking diversification and investment amid escalating tariff tensions.
Blue Origin lands New Glenn booster, matching SpaceX reusability and promising increased competition and capacity in commercial launch markets.
Apple halves commissions for Mini Apps and tightens rules on sharing personal data with third-party AI, reshaping mobile monetization and data flows.
CISA orders urgent patching of flawed Cisco firewalls amid active exploitation across U.S. government networks, highlighting critical infrastructure cyber risk.
Despite market jitters, AI financing surges: Cursor raises $2.3B at $29.3B valuation; Musk’s xAI targets $15B; JPMorgan says AI is durable opportunity.
Coatue’s Philippe Laffont says the IPO market is 'broken beyond repair,' underscoring exit bottlenecks for late-stage startups.
Boeing defense workers approve new contract, ending three-month strike, restoring production and reducing supply-chain disruption risk.
Tesla recalls 10,500 Powerwall 2 units in U.S. over overheating and fire risk, adding to scrutiny of home energy storage safety.
Nearby super-Earth identified as promising target for biosignature searches, boosting prospects for detecting life with next-gen telescopes.
Quantum communication breakthrough extends link distance 200-fold, advancing prospects for long-range quantum networks and secure communications.
